meanings.definition: To fail to sell or promote successfully.
meanings.sent1: The old-fashioned design unsells the product to younger customers.
meanings.sent2: The high price often unsells potential buyers.
meanings.sent3: The boring packaging unsells the idea of a fun surprise inside.
meanings.sent4: His lack of enthusiasm unsells the concept to investors.
meanings.sent5: The lack of customer reviews unsells the product's quality.

meanings.definition: To discourage or deter from buying.
meanings.sent1: The negative reviews unsell the product to interested shoppers.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive sales tactics unsell customers from making a purchase.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather unsells the idea of going out to shop.
meanings.sent4: Her skeptical attitude unsells the benefits of the new product.
meanings.sent5: The lack of warranty unsells the idea of a long-term investment.
